Job title: Model Risk Governance and Review - Rates Derivatives Quantitative Analysis - Associate
Description:
As part of Risk Management and Compliance, you are at the center of keeping JPMorgan Chase strong and resilient. You help the firm grow its business in a responsible way by anticipating new and emerging risks, and using your expert judgement to solve real-world challenges that impact our company, customers and communities. Our culture in Risk Management and Compliance is all about thinking outside the box, challenging the status quo and striving to be best-in-class.

Model Risk Governance and Review (MRGR) is responsible for end-to-end model risk management across the firm. The group assesses and helps mitigate the model risk of complex models used in the context of valuation, risk measurement, the calculation of capital, and more broadly for decision-making purposes. MRGR partners with Risk and Finance professionals and works closely with model developers and users. Team members have opportunities for exposure to a variety of business and functional areas.

The role currently available lies within MRGR Rates in London. The focus will be on model risk management and review of interest rates derivatives models.

Core responsibilities
Carry out model reviews: analyze conceptual soundness of complex pricing models, engines, and reserve methodologies; assess model behavior and suitability of pricing models/engines to particular products/structures.
Provide guidance on model usage and act as first point of contact for the business on all new models and changes to existing models.
Develop and implement alternative model benchmarks and compare the outcome of various models; Design model performance metrics.
Liaise with model developers, Risk and Valuation Control Groups and provide guidance on model risk.
Evaluate model performance on a regular basis.

Minimum Skills, Experience and Qualifications

We are looking for someone excited to join our organization. If you meet the minimum requirements below, you are encouraged to apply to be considered for this role.
Excellence in probability theory, stochastic processes, statistics, partial differential equations, and numerical analysis.
Very strong analytical and problem solving abilities.
MSc, PhD or equivalent in a quantitative discipline.
Inquisitive nature, ability to ask right questions and escalate issues, excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
Good understanding of option pricing theory (i.e. quantitative models for pricing and hedging derivatives)
Good coding skills, for example in C/C++ or Python

Additional Skills, Experience and Qualifications

The following additional items will be considered but are not required for this role
Trading desk support, model validation, or model design experience.
Experience with interest rates derivatives
J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

Job title: EMEA Travel Hospitality & Leisure Group - Analyst and Associate Levels
Description:
EMEA Travel Hospitality & Leisure Group
Role: Advisory Analyst / Associate
Location: London, United Kingdom
The Role
Your role will focus on travel, hospitality / hotel & leisure “THL” sector clients, working as part of our dedicated industry team to provide advice and hands-on support in helping our clients solve a variety of commercial, strategic and operational issues.
Our clients represent a broad range of industry stakeholders, from owners and investors (Private Equity, Institutional, etc.), to lenders, developers and some of the industry’s largest and most innovative operators and corporates. You will leverage your financial and analytical rigour to advise clients on many of the following matters:
Transformation, including implementation of large-scale organisational change and operational restructuring, identifying value creation opportunities (e.g. non-core divestitures, performance improvement), post-merger integration & carve-outs
Transactions, including buy- and sell-side pre-deal commercial and operating due diligence
Strategic and commercial advice, including market and feasibility analysis, business plan development and review
Restructuring, providing ongoing support to chief restructuring officers (CROs)
Whilst the role will focus on THL clients and assignments, you will have the opportunity to work across related industries. By the end of your first year, success would mean advancing your technical skills and developing your interpersonal skills to have direct exposure to decision-makers and influence over the resolution of your client’s business needs.
The Requirements
2-5 years’ experience in a major advisory firm and/or organisation of significant scale and complexity
Analytical rigour and financial acumen developed via roles in consulting, banking or directly from industry
Strong quantitative and analytical skills and the ability to problem-solve and find fact-based solutions, build business plan forecasts, demonstrate a working knowledge of accounting and adapt across sectors and projects
Expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Powerpoint
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Demonstrable passion for the travel, hospitality and/or leisure sectors
Willingness to travel within Europe and the Middle East (and potentially further afield)
Preferred Qualifications
Previous experience in transformation, transaction execution and strategic and/or commercial advisory
Demonstration of project or workstream leadership
Willingness to develop network across industry professionals
Business level in EMEA languages outside of English
Diversity & Inclusion
A&M’s entrepreneurial culture celebrates independent thinkers and doers who can positively impact our clients and shape our industry. The collaborative environment and engaging work—guided by A&M’s core values of Integrity, Quality, Objectivity, Fun, Personal Reward, and Inclusive Diversity—are the main reasons our people love working at A&M. Inclusive Diversity means we embrace diversity and we foster inclusiveness. It runs through how we recruit, develop employees, conduct business, support clients, and partner with vendors. It is the A&M way.

Company Description
Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil & Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.
An innovative place to work
There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.
Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.
An inclusive place to work
To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.
We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.
We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.
We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.
We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.
A rewarding place to work
Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.
We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.

About Wintermute

At Wintermute our mission is to enable, empower and advance the truly decentralized world for more transparent and efficient markets and products.

We do this by providing liquidity algorithmically across most trading venues in crypto, supporting all major centralized and decentralized trading venues, AMMs, RFQs, aggregators and chains. Wintermute is also offering best-in-class OTC products to crypto native as well as traditional financial institutions.

Wintermute is actively participating in the building and development of the blockchain ecosystem through investments from Wintermute Ventures, partnerships and co-development with upcoming protocols and incubation of own projects. We act as official market makers for a large number of the world’s highest profile blockchain projects.

Wintermute is a hyper-growth highly profitable business with a very ambitious vision and roadmap. We manage billions of dollars in assets and trade more than $5B/day. We are backed by Lightspeed, Pantera Capital, Sino Global Capital, Blockchain.com Ventures, Avon Ventures by Fidelity Investments, DeFi Alliance and other top tier investors. We are run as a technology company, not a financial service provider, and we build our culture around core values of ambition, collaboration, entrepreneurship, transparency and meritocracy.

Working at Wintermute
We are looking for a C++ Trading Platform Developer who is passionate about technology, interested in both low level details of how computer hardware operates and high-level design of large systems, as well as in data infrastructure. Someone who likes opening the hood to see how things work, has understanding of data structures, experience writing client-server network applications, and writing and optimising code for high performance. We welcome your previous experience from your own personal projects as well as commercial experience. We are looking for people who are passionate about technology and have experience looking under the hood to see how C++ standard libraries and other solutions are implemented. Interest in algorithmic and quantitative trading is a plus.
At Wintermute you will have an opportunity to grow and make direct impact on trading by developing and improving all the parts of the trading platform, data infrastructure and related software, while also getting advice and guidance from very experienced developers and traders, including the founders. You will get a lot of independence and responsibility right away, and you'll learn at an unprecedented speed! No legacy systems, no multiple levels of approvals, no bureaucracy; all developers report directly to CTO who is very hands on. You are judged by what you deliver, not by the hours your do.
It is up to you to make an impact! You will work alongside exceptionally sharp colleagues, learn how to write fail-safe code and improve performance and scalability of the trading system, a real challenge and a rare opportunity! We have flexible working arrangements, it’s the productivity that matters. At least several days a week in the office with our own gym, unlimited food and drinks are required.
What will you work on
A great advantage of this position is that it is varied, and it is also up to you to shape it in the direction that matches your talents and company needs. The focus of the role would be to work on the global trading platform that spans across many continents, with real time data capture, order entry on dozens of exchanges, robust connectivity and built in monitoring. You would be working on expanding and scaling up our trading platform, mainly using C++ and Python.
All the workstations and servers are running Linux, no windows in trading and the development team. We also keep things simple and easy to understand wherever possible which means designing, scalable and robust C++ and Python code is a main skill. We will share more technical details in the interviews. You will have opportunity to improve your knowledge of software optimisations, of building robust large-scale systems and to understand crypto currency trading.
Hard Skills requirements
Strong C++ skills are required - we will test
Experience with looking under the hood to see how C++ standard libraries work - we will test
Strong analytical skills - we will test
Understanding of networking, CPU and memory model, assembly language - desirable
Wintermute Offer
A unique opportunity to work on very interesting projects, get the level of responsibility and ownership that would be unlikely at any other project or trading firm
A unique opportunity to join one of the strongest and most successful CeFi teams globally
Great company culture: informal, non-hierarchical, ambitious, highly professional yet collaborative and entrepreneurial
A cool office in central London with a sci-fi touch
Although we are unable to accept fully remote candidates, we support significant flexibility in regards to working from home and working hours.
Weekly team events, such as team lunches, team dinners, team board games and Dota playing sessions; these are not obligatory in any sense, but this is what we like to do
On top of competitive base pay, we offer substantial performance based bonuses
We offer standard perks too, like pension, private health insurance and free food, but that’s probably not the right reason to join us
We offer UK work permits and help with relocation
Write to us if you
Write us a short, honest, and direct message if you'd like to apply.
Tell us about why you are interested in C++ development at Wintermute.
Do not send us generic copy paste applications, we are looking for authentic people who share our interests, values and ambitions!

Job Description
The TP ICAP Group is a world leading provider of market infrastructure.
Our purpose is to provide clients with access to global financial and commodities markets, improving price discovery, liquidity, and distribution of data, through responsible and innovative solutions.
Through our people and technology, we connect clients to superior liquidity and data solutions.
The Group is home to a stable of premium brands. Collectively, TP ICAP is the largest interdealer broker in the world by revenue, the number one Energy & Commodities broker in the world, the world’s leading provider of OTC data, and an award winning all-to-all trading platform.
The Group operates from more than 60 offices in 27 countries. We are 5,300 people strong. We work as one to achieve our vision of being the world’s most trusted, innovative, liquidity and data solutions specialist.
Role Overview:
The Analytics team is responsible for delivering all the indicative price and instrument information, in essence “the content”, of Fusion Rates Hub.
Managing a team of Quant Analysts, Quant Devs and Financial Engineers. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and supporting the Axiom platform for EMEA Rates, Forward Fx, EMG Markets, E+C, Credit. This will include both BAU and Change Delivery. The successful candidate will be working closely with the Front Office to translate business requirements into software solutions, being responsible for all aspects of the process – Requirements, Dev, Testing, Delivery and Support. This role will specifically cover the TP businesses.
Role Responsibilities:
Manage a team of quant analysts, quant developers and financial engineers.
Responsible for maintaining a high standard of delivery across the team, in accordance with Global Analytics standards, best practices and approach.
Responsible for managing the workflow of the team, including: - prioritisation of work items; delivery estimates; testing strategy; release procedure.
Preparing and presenting materials to communicate the status of planned development.
Providing regular progress updates to stakeholders from Technology and the various businesses supported, including Parameta.
Shared responsibility for minimizing downtime of solutions delivered by the Global Analytics team.
Mentoring and training junior members of the team.
Effective communication across the whole Global Analytics team.
Effective communication with IT, Operations, Compliance, and Risk departments.
Experience / Competencies:
Numerate degree required.
Proven experience in an Analytical role.
Experience using Software Development.
Experience in a Front Office role working directly with Brokers / Traders.
Knowledge of and Experience working in Financial Engineering.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Service oriented, adaptable, and resilient.
Demonstrated leadership and interpersonal skills.
Organisation skills, able to manage multiple tasks effectively.
Conscientious, self-motivated & goal oriented.
Ability to influence positively.
Ability to articulate problems, with a mindset of simplifying.
Highly analytical approach to testing and verification.
Company Statement:
The TP ICAP Group is committed to promoting Equality and Diversity and encouraging a culture that actively values difference. It is recognised that employees from different backgrounds and experiences can bring valuable insights to the work environment and enhance the way we work. TP ICAP aims to create a positive, cohesive and inclusive culture, where diversity is valued, respected and built upon. The objective is to recruit and retain a diverse workforce that reflects the global markets in which we work.
TP ICAP is also committed to ensuring that the backgrounds, beliefs and cultures of all its employees are respected and to ensuring that the working environment is free from discrimination, harassment, bullying or any other conduct which causes an employee’s suffering. The Group also is committed to encouraging diversity amongst its current workforce and candidates.

Strong experience of server-side development in C++ and Python, including multi-threading
Experienced developing front-office banking applications

Principal Experimentation Analyst
Location: Hybrid/Remote

About the Role:
At RS Group, we are on a mission to ‘Make Amazing Happen’ for our customers. To do that, we know that we cannot rely on intuition alone, and that data must lead the way.
Experimentation is fast becoming the methodology we use to make amazing happen, and as Senior Experimentation Analyst, you will drive the standards for experimentation analysis at RS Components. You will play a leading role in defining our patterns, practices, and processes for driving accurate and trustworthy business outcomes through experiments.
Operating from our group wide Centre of Excellence, you will be the trusted subject matter expert on experimentation analysis, supporting our business in its efforts to scale experimentation, and make intelligent decisions based on data-evidenced outcomes. Your role is one of doing, but also educating and empowering, where success is not derived solely from the outcomes you drive yourself, but the outcomes you enable others to realise.
You will own the end-to-end analysis and aggregation of data of our global experimentation efforts, working cross-functionally across the organisation to drive evolving maturity in the way we think about, measure and report on individual experiments, and demonstrating how these impact key business metrics.
Collaborating across the business with data & software engineers, data scientists, developers, and specialists, you’ll ensure we have the right, metrics processes, tools, and technologies to provide accurate and actionable experiment outcomes across our global business.
This is a fantastic opportunity for someone interested in growing their own personal and professional skills in a well-reputed, forward-thinking, and dedicated experimentation function within a global business on a lightning-fast growth curve.

Key Deliverables for my role
In this role, you’ll:
Set the standards for programme performance benchmarking, monitoring of our global experimentation platform and execution of regular A/A tests to ensure high levels of data quality in our continually evolving digital estate.
Tell stories through data – breaking down complex problems and turning them into actionable insights, using an array of data visualisation techniques.
Define and maintain our macro/micro experiment metrics & goal trees, ensuring that experiments are run with well understood primary, secondary, and business aligned metrics.
Mentor associate and mid-level experimentation analysts, acting as their first port of call for triaging experiment analyses and helping them to develop and grow in their own careers.
Collaborate with senior stakeholders across our digital experience teams to identify global business opportunities, where experimentation can accelerate our speed to value realisation.
Identify blockers in our ability to scale, and take a leading role in implementing new processes, tools, technologies, or capabilities to drive programme velocity.
Be accountable for the end-to-end analysis and reporting of global combined experiment outcomes, demonstrating ROI, operational efficiencies, and profit protection.
Act as an ambassador for experimentation across the global organisation, evangelising for its uses, educating others on the benefits of the methodology, and changing hearts and minds to become more data driven.
Report on key individual experiment outcomes, learnings, opportunities, and programme performance across the business, up to c-suite level.
Drive continuous improvement in experimentation & digital data.
Educate and enable individual product teams to better understand their experiment results, hosting training & deep dive sessions to increase organisation-wide experimentation maturity.

Key opportunities for growth in this role:
In this role, you will have the opportunity to develop and grow your data analysis skills in a FTSE100 company with big growth ambitions, with a view to longer term, moving towards either a Principal Experimentation Analyst role, or Experimentation Manager role, depending on whether the individual wishes to build deep specialisms, or move more into people management, strategy, and vision

Useful Experience:
Essential Experience/Attributes/Skills:
Experience in a mid-level or senior technical analyst role (Analytics, CRO/Experimentation) (3+ years).
Exceptional leadership skills: Passion, Humility, Trust
Direct experience working in-house, agency side or consulting as an analyst on Experimentation/CRO programmes.
Effective collaboration in cross-functional teams spanning many departments and disciplines.
Excellent knowledge of A/B Testing and Experimentation principles.
Strong demonstrable experience of using experimentation platforms such as Optimizely or Adobe Target.
Deep experience and competency in the use of analytics platforms such as Adobe analytics or Google analytics.
Exceptional stakeholder management and communication skills, working with technical and non-technical stakeholders, up to c-suite level.
Highly autonomous & pro-active, with a strong attention to detail.
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI, Tablaeu, Google Data Studio or similar.
Nice to have attributes/skills
Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, web browser debugging and data layers.
Strong knowledge of UX guidelines and principles
Experience working with various qualitative and quantitative data types, such as User Research, Voice of Customer, Heatmapping and SAP/CRM data.
Experience in helping experimentation programmes to grow and scale at enterprise level.
Understanding of data science techniques, such as Bayesian statistics, linear regression, and causal inference.
Good understanding of Python or R.

Our business has operations in three geographical regions – the Americas, EMEA and APAC, supported by global organisations for supply chain, corporate functions, marketing, and product & supplier management. Our market today is large, fragmented, local in nature and digitally immature. Only a few international distributors serve it, with many regional and local providers, who largely trade offline. Currently we estimate the global market value to be c.£400bn, with our global market share <1%. We stock over 2500 supplier brands, 500K products and 63% of our sales are digital.

At Wintermute our mission is to enable, empower and advance the truly decentralized world for more transparent and efficient markets and products.

We do this by providing liquidity algorithmically across most trading venues in crypto, supporting all major centralized and decentralized trading venues, AMMs, RFQs, aggregators and chains. Wintermute is also offering best-in-class OTC products to crypto native as well as traditional financial institutions.

Wintermute is actively participating in the building and development of the blockchain ecosystem through investments from Wintermute Ventures, partnerships and co-development with upcoming protocols and incubation of own projects. We act as official market makers for a large number of the world’s highest profile blockchain projects.

Wintermute is a hyper-growth highly profitable business with a very ambitious vision and roadmap. We manage billions of dollars in assets and trade more than $5B/day. We are backed by Lightspeed, Pantera Capital, Sino Global Capital, Blockchain.com Ventures, Avon Ventures by Fidelity Investments, DeFi Alliance and other top tier investors. We are run as a technology company, not a financial service provider, and we build our culture around core values of ambition, collaboration, entrepreneurship, transparency and meritocracy.

Working at Wintermute

We are looking for an Options Trader with 2+ years of experience in an option MM role, strong coding skills (Python) and a curiosity about HFT, market making and crypto trading. We run a lean, flat-hierarchy option trading team, competing successfully against teams many times our size. You will be able to contribute to all aspects of the trading setup while also getting advice and guidance from very experienced traders and developers, including the founders/ management team. You will get a lot of independence and responsibility right away, and you'll learn at an unprecedented speed! No legacy systems, no corporate bureaucracy, no multiple levels of approvals. It is up to you to make an impact.

What will you work on

You will have the chance to work on the full options stack - from valuation/ fitting to systematic market making to discretionary position taking. You will have the chance to expand the options business across all three of cefi, defi, and OTC. We will share more technical details in the interviews. The point is: there is no limit set by the company!

Note: we are looking for people with strong quantitative and coding skills, but this is a trading (not a research) role first and foremost.
Hard Skills Requirements
2+ years of experience trading in an options market making role.
Strong Python skills - ideally 1-3 years of experience coding in Python, be that through work, study or personal project experience
Excellent quantitative and analytical skills
Crypto experience is a plus. However, we are open to applicants with knowledge of other asset classes.
Other Requirements
Have an owner mentality - you focus on ultimate result (short and long-term P&L for the company), focus on strategically growing the business for the future vs fast/opportunistic profits
Love problem solving, and love seeing your products work; you do whatever it takes to do what’s needed (trading, coding, analysing data, collaborating)
Determined, ambitious yet humble, willing to work hard and learn on the way
Like meritocracy and being judged by what you deliver
Have an entrepreneurial mindset versus working 9-to-5 mentality; prepared to work non-standard working hours (since we are a high-growth startup operating in 24/7 crypto world)
Like working in the team environment (not fully remote), at least 75% working from our London office
Wintermute Offer
A unique opportunity to work on very interesting projects, get the level of responsibility and ownership that would take 5-10 years to get in a traditional trading company/bank/hedge fund
A unique opportunity to join a high growth startup and one of the strongest and highest potential crypto startups based in Europe
Great culture: highly professional and ambitious, yet informal, non-hierarchical, collaborative and entrepreneurial
A cool office in central London with a sci-fi touch
Aligned incentive structure: a significant part of your compensation is performance-based with substantial upside
Tips for Successful Application
Only apply to us if you are genuinely interested or curious about this role and the space; this is not for someone who is just looking for "a job" or is very mercenary
Do your research: look at our website and social media channels
Write us a short, honest, and direct message if you'd like to apply. Tell us about why you are interested in crypto and market making in general and in Wintermute in particular.
Do not send us generic copy paste applications, we are looking for authentic people who share our interests, values and ambitions! If you don't have some obviously matching experience or skills, make sure you state very clearly what you can bring or how your experience is relevant/transferable (but note, we do require Python knowledge)
Prepare to be tested on your Python knowledge. Your knowledge and ability to get things done fast is very important to us
Do your homework on what hft/market making/algo trading is. (Hint: we are not in the business of position taking, directional betting, stock/token picking, technical analysis, "AI" (as in the buzz-word) and we are not a research business for the sake of research)
We get a lot of applications, so unfortunately, we won't be able to proceed if you simply press "submit button"; we do promise to reply to everyone who puts time and effort into making the application relevant!

We are recruiting for a Director of Data Analytics
About Nesta
We are Nesta, the UK’s innovation agency for social good. We design, test and scale solutions to society’s biggest problems. Our three missions are to give every child a fair start, help people live healthy lives, and create a sustainable future where the economy works for both people and the planet.
For over 20 years, we have worked to support, encourage and inspire innovation. We work in three roles: as an innovation partner working with frontline organisations to design and test new solutions, as a venture builder supporting new and early stage businesses, and as a system shaper creating the conditions for innovation.
Harnessing the rigour of science and the creativity of design, we work relentlessly to change millions of lives for the better. Find out more at nesta.org.uk
Overview
Nesta’s 2030 strategy articulates our ambition to significantly improve the lives of millions of people by pursuing three innovation missions. We want people in the UK to have a Fairer Start in life, to live a Healthy Life , and to have a Sustainable Future . Our focus is squarely on furthering these three missions, and we have specific goals for each that guide our work.
We believe in the power of data to effect change. We see immense potential to push the boundaries of how data is used in public services and social movements - such as identifying problems earlier using predictive analytics, matching resources with needs more accurately, tailoring services in highly personalised ways, or combining human and machine intelligence at scale.
The Director of Data Analytics will lead Nesta’s Data Analytics Practice (DAP), an interdisciplinary team of data scientists, data engineers, data visualisation and product developers. Nesta’s Practices , teams of experts in different disciplines, work closely with mission teams (teams of experts on each issue) and others around the organisation, to advance Nesta’s missions. Some DAP members are embedded in mission teams.
DAP also works closely with the Behavioural Insights Team ( BIT ), an operationally independent research consultancy owned by Nesta, on projects that pursue social impact through work with clients in the public, private and third sectors in the UK and internationally. The Director of Data Analytics will oversee both Nesta’s Data Analytics Practice and BIT’s Head of Data Science and their reports. Overall, the Director will oversee approximately 30 staff across Nesta and BIT.
For Nesta, the Director will ensure that our data analytics capabilities are used intelligently and efficiently with maximum impact on our missions. This will require close coordination with other teams and disciplines, including both being responsive to colleagues’ interests and priorities and helping colleagues understand the full potential of and use cases for data analytics. They will also be responsible for developing the team’s technical expertise and for building and maintaining the necessary technical infrastructure and processes to maximise team efficiency and efficacy.
To help maintain cutting-edge capabilities in a rapidly evolving field, DAP also undertakes externally-funded work that is broader in focus than our three missions but allows us to build and maintain a stronger team. The Director oversees business development in line with agreed priorities, ensuring projects pursued contribute sufficient income and contribute to organisational goals, for example through the development of new methods that can be applied to our missions.
For BIT, the Director will support BIT’s Head of Data Science in embedding data science in BIT’s day-to-day work and developing BIT’s capabilities in data science skills, including by supporting resource sharing, knowledge exchange, and joint skills development across the two organisations. The Director will also support BIT’s Head of Data Science in business development and in identifying and securing exciting new opportunities to apply data science in the context of behavioural science research.
Over time we expect Nesta’s Practices and BIT’s teams of technical experts to increasingly work closely together. This will enable both organisations to access cutting-edge expertise that can further their impact goals, and will enable methodological experts in both organisations to deploy and develop their skills on a range of projects in not-for-profit and commercial settings that achieve real social impact. Under the supervision of the incoming Chief Analyst (a new role overseeing Nesta’s and BIT’s technical teams), the Director will work to bring this vision to life.
The Role
The role has three main components. First, setting strategy and direction. Second, being a technical expert who delivers and helps others deliver high quality work. Third, providing organisational leadership and managing people day-to-day.
Strategy / Direction Ensure that DAP has a clear, widely-understood and widely bought-into articulation of its role and priorities over the next 2-3 years. This will build on the strategy work conducted prior to the Director’s appointment (draft ‘DAP strategy’) Bring that strategy to life through effective team leadership, resource allocation and prioritisation - problem-solving as needed and managing any issues that emerge Work with BIT’s Head of Data Science to ensure BIT’s data science capabilities are effectively deployed to further BIT’s impact and commercial goals on an ongoing basis Identify the similarities and differences between BIT’s and Nesta’s data analytics / data science needs and ensure any relevant synergies are made use of to both organisations’ mutual gain Ensure a strong impact ‘return’ on Nesta’s and BIT’s investments in these capabilities Oversee business development and fundraising for DAP. Maximise the quality, financial contribution and relevance of opportunities pursued and the efficiency of business development and delivery activities. Ensure team focus remains clear and directed at organisational priorities
Technical Work / Delivery Identify and articulate opportunities for self and team to take on ambitious data analytics projects/programmes that make a big difference to Nesta’s missions and BIT’s goals. Work closely with colleagues in other Nesta teams and BIT to develop and prioritise among opportunities Identify and pursue a technical vision for developing the practice of data analytics at Nesta (what capabilities we want to build over time, where we want to push boundaries, and how that can make a real difference to our missions) that fits within our resourcing bounds Stay abreast of the latest techniques and methodological developments in the field, providing technical guidance and inspiration to team members Oversee the team’s technical and programme management infrastructure Actively participate in project/programme design Establish and where necessary conduct appropriate quality assurance of team outputs and processes Help build team credibility internally and externally, including (where relevant to team and organisational priorities): Building relationships with leading academic institutions and technical communities Exploring opportunities to disseminate team outputs through leading conferences and journals Promoting and disseminating the work of the Practice internally and externally, including ‘packaging’ the work for non-technical audiences
Management / Leadership Collaboration - ensure teams are working well with colleagues. E.g. for DAP this means working closely with mission teams, other Practices and BIT. Identify blockers to collaboration and help identify and implement solutions Staff engagement - ensure team members are engaged and productive, and identify and deliver changes as needed to ensure high staff engagement (as measured by periodic org-wide surveys) Organisational leadership - act as a bridge between the priorities of the Chief Analyst and the work of the teams the Director oversees. Positively represent org-wide priorities and deal with or escalate concerns as needed Take a proactive approach to organisational growth and change, ensuring DAP’s position and role in the organisation continues to adapt and be well-understood by other leaders. Lead the team through periods of change when needed and create the conditions for the longer-term stability and clarity of role that will allow the team to thrive Oversee and manage DAP’s budget, with the support of the Senior Programme Manager Line manage data engineering, programme management and product development leads, and data science leads Lead by example on quality standards and ethics and help other team members to do the same Participate actively in Nesta’s leadership group (Directors and Heads) through periodic Leadership Breakfasts, Strategy Progress Reviews, etc., and engage positively with organisation-wide change initiatives and priorities (e.g. development of the ‘Nesta Way’, a cross-Nesta articulation of how we aspire to address knotty social challenges using the tools at our disposal)
The Person

About the role
We are seeking a committed and passionate Quantitative Data Engineer to work with us on our climate technology platform!
The successful candidate will sit in the Product team and build out a comprehensive information-scraping and analysis tool to measure business disruption and (eventually) develop this into a distinguished product feature. The successful candidate will be working across a technology stack that includes Python, C++, PostgreSQL / PostGIS, and NoSQL databases, as well as dabbling in technologies offered by Amazon Web Services (AWS) infrastructure.
This is an incredibly trailblazing and rewarding position, and you would report directly to Climate X’s Chief Product Officer.
The impact you’ll own
Ability to utilise Natural Language Processing, Regular Expressions, and similar techniques to extract physical asset addresses from company websites and assign such locations/assets to relevant type and industry categories.
Pipelining a solution to run at scale, in parallel, and on Climate X's Amazon Web Services (AWS) backend.
Undertake initial research for and rapidly prototype a Proof of Concept (PoC) for the financial impacts of business disruption associated with physical asset addresses.
Create a geocoding module with Mapbox/Google Places/alternative APIs to source information that is not readily available, conducting basic spatial analytics on results.
Working with Front End Developers in the Climate X Engineering team to deliver a visualised / User Interface version of the Business Disruption module, integrated into the Climate X risk analytics platform Spectra, including product requirements and UAT.
Conduct continuous documentation of both the technical solution and user guides for the Spectra Business Disruption module - and be ready to take ownership of the solution when presenting to (prospective) clients.
Delivering ad-hoc customer requests before the solution is productionised.
Researching ways to improve and optimise the existing approach.
Explaining the end product complexities to non-technical audiences including internal and external stakeholders.
What you bring
Relevant Agile environment experience in one or more of the following: software engineering, infrastructure, automation.
Demonstratable capabilities in at least one low-level language (e.g. C/C++/Java/C#) and one scripting language (Python, R) – or similar.
Proven expertise working on Public Cloud-based environments (AWS, GCP, Azure) from both a services and infrastructure perspective.
Excellent analytical and quantitative skills, with a strong knowledge of data modelling and data analysis.
Capacity for independent and creative thinking/writing on research and statistical problems.
Ability to work with data from multiple sources, and experience working with large data sets.
A strong eye for process improvement and a proven record of accomplishment in automation.
Ability to understand complex systems quickly and to improve processes proactively.
Capability for handling multiple stakeholders, have excellent multitasking skills and be able to prioritise competing workloads.
What makes you stand out
Understanding application profiling and observability tools, including Prometheus/Grafana and large-scale distributed systems would also be beneficial. Knowledge of networking and web protocols would be a plus.
Comfortable participating in language, framework, and platform selection processes, with respect to data tools and software.
Ability to exercise excellent time management and meet multiple deadlines
Demonstrated excellence in project management and organisation
High level of critical thinking and analytical skills.

Your compensation is determined based on the value you create. We'll also reward you with employee shares based on merit & performance. We are a genuine meritocracy, free from outdated HR practices.

Climate X is a purpose-driven climate adaptation data company set to revolutionise how the world manages assets, property, and infrastructure.
We’ve embarked on an exciting project to give our customers meaningful insights into how our changing climate will impact their property. From individuals with one property to businesses with millions of assets, our platform displays risks from potentially damaging severe weather events across multiple climate change scenarios and calculates the cost of that damage to the asset valuation.
Climate X will help customers save millions of pounds, be more resilient to climate change, meet incoming regulatory requirements and make smarter investment decisions.
We work with the UK’s leading climate scientists, AI specialists and financial services professionals.

About The Role
As a Design Researcher at TPXimpact, you’ll be responsible for exploring and gaining a deep understanding of user and organisational behaviours and needs in order to support and transform the delivery of public and non-for-profit policy and services. This includes everything from defining the research objectives to using the most appropriate methods from secondary, primary and participatory action research, even customising your own to develop actionable insights and measure the success of design solutions.

Currently, we’re solving problems with a range of clients from social care services to housing and digital land planning, from improving health services to education and building capability and design maturity in central government departments.

On client projects, you’ll work in delivery and policy teams to facilitate a deep understanding of the people and communities that use services and the organisations that deliver them. You’ll work as part of multidisciplinary teams, with designers to policy specialists and developers and collaboratively with other TPXimpact teams, from org design and change to community and political engagement. Within TPXimpact, you’ll be part of the Design research team and contribute to how we define and iterate our community of practice with the Head of Design Research.

We need more talented researchers to join our team who have a high level of curiosity to learn from a spectrum of perspectives and want to create a positive impact through their work.

We’re looking for people who might be seeking that next level in their career or at a similar level and interested in expanding their skills and domain experience somewhere new.

What you’ll do
As a Design Research at TPXimpact, you will be:
Problem framing : framing assumptions or hypotheses to prioritise and work with.
Secondary research: making sure that TPXimpact and client teams learn about the right things by consolidating and building on existing knowledge, desk research and data analysis.
Designing and planning creative research : including sample design, recruitment, screeners, field guides and process management.
Primary research (qualitative and quantitative): using a variety of qualitative and quantitative research methods with individual users, staff or stakeholders to understand people, behaviour, context, culture and ideas.
Participatory and community research : research with people and places to support community organising and action. Developing relationships with organisations and individuals to be part of a bigger network of assets, strengths and partnerships.
Creating actionable research insights: Using analysis and synthesis methods, linking qualitative to quantitative data and thinking about systems-level and behavioural patterns and frameworks to develop significant insights.
Evaluation and impact measurement: working with teams to ensure robust impact measurement and theories of change throughout a design process, making sure solutions meet the needs of users and stakeholder outcomes.
Communicating research: making research findings engaging, relevant, impactful and actionable for design through a variety of formats such as insights, decks, white papers, stories, videos, exhibits, etc.
Identifying opportunity areas and bringing people together through research: enabling teams to contextualise, refine and prioritise concepts and requirements. Building shared understanding and knowledge that can be referred back to throughout a design process.
Mentoring and capability transfer: guiding more junior TPXimpact and client researchers and practice sharing across the organisation and with client teams.

About You
Essential skills and experience

To succeed in this role, you will need:
Experience doing research using a variety of methods with users, staff and stakeholders - culminating in a sound ability to scope a research process, lead fieldwork and conduct interviews
Experience designing and advocating for responsible research by considering ethical, safeguarding, inclusive and accessibility factors throughout
Experience in connecting different sources of primary and secondary insight to provide the most relevant information.
A solid understanding of basic statistical concepts and representative sample design.
Ability to apply mixed methods with both qualitative and quantitative data to generate robust insights
Experience of working within multidisciplinary agile teams
Experience of working in complex environments and navigating senior stakeholder groups to influence
Ability to balance robust study design rigour and inspiration with the practicalities of a fast-paced environment, balancing internal business priorities with external delivery
To be willing to travel in the UK to work with our clients for the purposes of project delivery and prepared to stay overnight on occasion if required (subject to Covid restrictions).
You don’t need to have experience in central or local government to work with us – although it is useful if you do – but it’s important that you’ve worked on some reasonably complex user facing services.

Desirable skills and experience

We’re keen to talk to you if you also have:
Experience working in Central Government on Discovery, Alpha, Beta or Live projects following the GDS service standard
Experience researching within policy creation or changes - considering behavioural and social science
Experience working with participatory and community-led design research, identifying and mitigating power dynamics and bias in the design research process
Experience in creative storytelling - make an audience think/feel things they’ve wouldn’t have otherwise
Experience researching future trends or for speculative design methods
Experience of working in an agency or consultancy
An understanding of service design, interaction design principles, so that you can assist with these elements of a project if needed

About Us
Why work at TPXimpact
The opportunity to achieve impact in the public sector through your work
Flexible working to help you function at your best
We’re collaborative, and will readily give our time to help your development and invest in your training
Everyone has a voice - inclusivity and respect are key to our culture
A focus on wellbeing with access to a range of wellness activities and an annual Fitness challenges
An inclusive workplace with active advocacy networks for women, LGBTQI employees and people from ethnic minorities
Some of the benefits include:
30 days holiday + Bank Holidays
2 charity volunteer days for causes that you are passionate about
Working from home allowance
Maternity/Paternity - 6months Maternity Leave, 3 months Paternity Leave
Life Assurance
Employer Pension Contribution of 5%
Health Cash Plan
Personal Learning & Development budget
Employee Assistance Programme
Access to equity in the business through a Share Incentive Plan
Green incentive programmes including Electric Vehicle Leasing and the Cycle to Work Scheme
Dental insurance
Financial advice
Health assessments

About TPXimpact - Consultancy

TPXimpact transforms the organisations, services and systems that underpin society. We're here to deliver ambitious and sustainable digital outcomes that improve how individuals and society experience the world.

TPXimpact started with the idea that business could be done differently. That, organisations should make a positive difference to people's lives and be a force for good in the world.

We drive fundamental change in approaches to product and service development, delivery and technology. Our agile, multidisciplinary teams use technology, design and data to deliver better results, improving outcomes for individuals, organisations and communities.
By working in the open in partnership with our clients, we not only transform their systems and services but also build the capability of their teams, so work can continue without us in the longer term. Our focus is sustainable change, always delivered with positive impact.

We’re an inclusive employer, and we care about diversity in our teams. Let us know in your application if you have accessibility requirements during the interview.

Company Description

We are looking for a Real Estate Analyst to help build, guide, and execute our European growth and store optimization strategies for Abercrombie & Fitch, Hollister, Abercrombie kids, and Gilly Hicks. The ideal candidate is a self-starter who enjoys working in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment with the ability to help build and manage an international new store pipeline in addition to optimizing existing real estate assets. This role is based in London and will report to the Senior Manager of International Real Estate based in London.
What will you be doing?
Help in creating, presenting, and executing A&F’s European real estate strategy
Collaborate and maintain strong, productive relationships with EMEA leads to execute big picture strategies and goals
Assist with site reviews and work directly with Real Estate Management, landlords and brokers to ensure opportunities meet space needs and brand requirements
Support Real Estate Manager and Director in deal negotiations, including developing letters of intent, term sheets, landlord works letters and lease agreements
Prepare Site Evaluation and Site Approval packages to Real Estate Leadership for Real Estate Committee approvals
Organize new store proposals inclusive of proformas, demographics, analytics, LOI’s, LOD’s, design criteria, area and market maps, sales forecasts, etc. to determine store financial feasibility
Partner with Real Estate Strategy and Real Estate Finance to create and utilize tools, systems, and process for market evaluation, pipeline development, and business strategies
Interface with Real Estate Manager and attorneys to review, negotiate risk-protections, and finalize leases
Partner with design and construction to ensure a seamless process from store proposal-to-open.
Build and maintain the lease database with key lease data and communicate lease dates to appropriate internal teams.
Collaborate with internal teams to ensure stores are open on time; help ensure time-based information is secured for timely openings, including permitting obstacles, zoning compliance, specialty approvals, permitting timelines, tenant and sign criteria, impact fees, Real Estate taxes, etc.
Develop and maintain the critical real estate and retailing industry relationships, including developers, brokers, and retailers, to stay informed of business and industry trends.
What will you need to bring?
Relevant Bachelor’s degree (finance, real estate, or strategy a plus)
2 to 3 years of relevant work experience in European real estate
A love for real estate, fashion, and brands
Strong negotiation skills with an ability to interpret both quantitative and qualitative datasets Passion and intellectual curiosity to find and capture business value
Confident, and concise communication and presentation skills, verbal and written
Experience in working cross-functionally and dealing with ambiguity
Demonstrated ability to consistently meet deadlines
Strong time management skills and experience managing multiple projects/deadlines simultaneously
Excels under pressure; ability to work both independently and cooperatively in a fast-paced environment
Ability to travel internationally from 10%, up to 25%, of the time
Our Company
Abercrombie & Fitch Co. (A&F Co.) is a global retailer of five iconic, omnichannel lifestyle brands catering to the kid through millennial customer: Abercrombie & Fitch, abercrombie kids, Hollister, Gilly Hicks and Social Tourist. At A&F Co., we’re here for our associates, customers and communities on the journey to being and becoming who they are – and because no journey is the same, we strive to create an inclusive culture, where everyone is free to share ideas.
Our Values
We lead with purpose and always put our people first, which is evidenced by our Great Place to Work™ Certification, as well as being a 2021 recipient of Fortune’s Best Workplaces in Retail, and named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign for 16 consecutive years. We’re proud to offer equitable compensation and benefits, [including flexibility and competitive Paid Time Off], as well as education and engagement events, including various Associate Resource Groups, volunteer opportunities and additional time off to give back to our global communities.
Our Brand
Are you someone who views the world through summer-tinted lenses? Can you seamlessly slip into the teenage-summer-break version of yourself? Are you picturing your old Facebook statuses right now? We know you’re probably cringing….old Facebook statuses will do that to you.
We’re looking for people who are invested in the teen mindset, who get Gen Z and who want to empower teens to be their most confident, comfortable and capable selves. We’re more than a clothing brand -¬¬ we’re a platform for amplifying teen stories. We believe in living like it’s summer all year long, because to us, summer isn’t a season. It’s a state of mind.

Role Location
The role is full-time and based in Bristol with travel required across the UK for specific project opportunities. There will be the opportunity for some home working.
The Company
Air Quality Consultants Ltd was established in 1993 and has become the leading UK air quality consultancy providing specialist services for developers, industry, local authorities and central Government, both within the UK and internationally.
Air Quality Consultants Ltd alongside its sister companies, Noise Consultants Ltd and Logika Consultants Ltd, form the Logika Group of Companies. We comprise more than 60 environmental experts based in the UK and continental Europe, with the three companies managed by a single senior leadership team. We see flexibility and collaboration as essential to our continued success and we manage the Group of companies as if a single entity.
We provide people with the opportunity to progress and work on interesting projects with a wide range of valued clients who operate in a variety of sectors.
The Role
To support our continued organic growth, we are seeking to recruit a member of staff at Assistant Consultant grade to work as part of our team of around 35 air quality specialists based in the UK.
We provide a comprehensive service relating to modelling, monitoring and assessment of air quality, dust, odour and carbon impacts. We will provide training on the relevant software and skills needed in air quality consultancy and will provide you with in-house support and relevant experience in developing you professionally. We actively encourage attendance at external events and membership to professional bodies such as the IAQM and IES.
The successful candidate will be involved in exciting air quality and carbon projects across a range of sectors including transport, energy, industry and government. You will be involved in working with the team in delivering stand-alone air quality assessments for new developments, undertaking air quality monitoring, preparing chapters for Environmental Statements including those that form part of Development Consent Order (DCO) applications and undertaking leading edge research projects.
Depending on experience and interest, there are opportunities to support our Environmental Policy and Economics Practice. This new part of our business provides high quality policy advice, strategic insight as well as scientific, policy and economic analysis in a range of environmental policy areas. These include air quality and emissions and climate change.
This is an exceptional opportunity at an exciting time both for our business and for environmental consultancy. With us, you will be involved at the heart of the team and will play a key role in the delivery of our work. You will work in a friendly, supportive environment and will be given one to one support, mentoring, learning and development via experienced colleagues. External training will be provided where required.
Skills and experience we are looking for
You will have ideally worked or gained experience through academic research or environmental consultancy in the field of air quality or climate change.
Essential
Strong mathematical / quantitative analysis skills
Good communication skills, both orally and in writing
Strong technical capability and ability to review and interpret data
Strong report writing skills
An understanding of the issues related to air quality including air quality legislation, policy and guidance
Strong organisational skills with the ability to prioritise and deliver work to tight deadlines
High level of proficiency in using Microsoft Excel and Word
Ability and willingness to undertake site-based monitoring and field work
A full clean UK driving license, as travel will be required
Desirable
Recent programming and/or machine learning experience
Statistical analysis skills
Qualifications * Relevant A-Levels or equivalent
BSc or higher in an appropriate science-based discipline
What we offer
You would be part of one of the most highly respected air quality consultancy teams in the world, involved in shaping air quality best practice both in the UK and internationally.
We are a growing Group of companies that wants to do things differently, with an exciting future that will help you shape and realise your ambitions. You will have a great opportunity to work with a talented and dedicated team and be able to develop your career as the company grows.
We ensure we can support our employees through offering wellbeing programmes and policies that support individuals. These include flexible working, trained mental health first aiders and readily available support through our Employee Assistance programme.
Furthermore, along with a competitive salary, we offer a benefits package which includes an enhanced pension scheme, death in service life cover, discretionary bonus scheme, the option to buy additional annual leave, and much more.
Air Quality Consultants Equal Opportunities Policy is to ensure that no applicant receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of age, disability, gender, reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation.

Job title: Model Risk Governance and Review - Credit Derivatives Quantitative Analysis - VP
Description:
As part of Risk Management and Compliance, you are at the center of keeping JPMorgan Chase strong and resilient. You help the firm grow its business in a responsible way by anticipating new and emerging risks, and using your expert judgement to solve real-world challenges that impact our company, customers and communities. Our culture in Risk Management and Compliance is all about thinking outside the box, challenging the status quo and striving to be best-in-class.

Model Risk Governance and Review Group (MRGR) carries out the review of models used across the firm and model risk governance. MRGR has a global presence across New York, London, Mumbai, and Paris.

The group assesses and helps mitigate the model risk of complex models used in the context of valuation, risk measurement, the calculation of capital, and more broadly for decision-making purposes. Derivative instruments are widely used in the Bank's businesses as part of the core trading activities or for risk management purposes. Derivative instruments make extensive use of models subject to validation by MRGR. Model validation includes an evaluation of conceptual soundness; designing and conducting experiments to compare a model's prediction against actual outcomes or against the output of alternative benchmark models; and designing and monitoring model performance metrics. MRGR partners with Risk and Finance professionals and works closely with model developers and users. Team members have opportunities for exposure to a variety of business areas.

As part of the firm's model risk management function, MRGR is also charged with developing model risk policy and control procedures, providing guidance on a model's appropriate usage in the business context, evaluating ongoing model performance testing, and ensuring that model users are aware of the model strengths and limitations. Model manager roles within MRGR provide attractive career paths for model development and model validation quants in a dynamic setting working closely with Front Office Trading Desks, Desk Quants or Model Developers, Risk and Finance professionals, where they act as key stakeholders on day-to-day model-related risk management decisions

The role currently available lies within MRGR London and will have a focus on the review of Credit derivatives models and model risk governance.

Core responsibilities
Carry out model reviews: analyze conceptual soundness of complex pricing models, engines, and reserve methodologies; assess model behavior and suitability of pricing models/engines to particular products/structures.
Develop and implement alternative model benchmarks and compare the outcome of various models; design model performance metrics.
Liaise with model developers, Trading Desk, Risk and Finance professionals to provide oversight and guidance on model risk and appropriate usage, controls around model restrictions & limitations, and findings for ongoing performance assessment & testing
Maintain model risk control apparatus of the bank for the coverage area & serve as first point of contact
Keep up with the latest developments in coverage area in terms of products, markets, models, risk management practices and industry standards
Manage a sub-team of people carrying out review and governance.

Minimum Skills, Experience and Qualifications

We are looking for someone excited to join our organization. If you meet the minimum requirements below, you are encouraged to apply to be considered for this role.
Previous experience in a FO or model risk quantitative role.
Excellence in probability theory, stochastic processes, statistics, partial differential equations, and numerical analysis.
Good understanding of option pricing theory (i.e. quantitative models for pricing and hedging derivatives).
Experience with Monte Carlo and numerical methods.
Very strong analytical and problem solving abilities.
MSc, PhD or equivalent.
C/C++ programming, Python.
Inquisitive nature, ability to ask right questions and escalate issues, excellent communication skills (written and verbal).
Team work oriented.

Additional Skills, Experience and Qualifications

The following additional items will be considered but are not required for this role
Experience with Monte Carlo and numerical methods.
Experience with Credit derivatives
J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

Technical role in our London-based digital rail start-up. You will be working on fascinating technical problems in the rail industry, helping us to scale our products and develop new solutions. Excellent career prospects and share options available.

Who we are
JNCTION is a market leading scale-up business based in London working on a range of innovative digital applications and projects within the rail industry.
The UK rail industry is undergoing the largest transformation seen in a generation and at JNCTION we are positioning ourselves to be at the centre of this change.
As we enter a phase of rapid commercialisation and growth, we are now seeking a Back-end or Full-stack Developer to help lead and deliver a variety of leading-edge software technology and data-led projects.

What you will be doing
You will be working on a wide variety of JNCTION’s data, software and consulting projects, using your software engineering experience to help deliver solutions to improve rail in the UK. One example of the tools you may be working on includes our Decision Support Tool, currently used by the train operator LNER to help minimise delays to passengers during times of disruption.
You’ll be expected to work with a wide variety of programming languages and platforms at JNCTION, due to the varying nature of our clients’ development environments. However, our current projects generally include the use of the following:
Node.js (TypeScript)
ExpressJS/ React
Python
SQL (MariaDB, PostgreSQL)
Microsoft Azure/AWS Cloud
Java
Apache data technologies(Camel, ActiveMQ, Spark, Kafka, Airflow, etc.)
Docker
You’ll also work closely with our Head of Software who will provide direction and technical support in your projects.
JNCTION’s fast-paced, rapid growth environment means you could be expected to take on other roles from time-to-time.

About you
You’ll ideally have at least 1 year’s relevant experience working in a software or data engineering capacity. If this experience is within rail, then even better! But don’t worry if not, an interest in learning the various intricacies of the rail industry and its data is all that’s needed.
You’ll enjoy solving problems and working with ambiguity– we work on a huge variety of problems and therefore can never be certain how one day will pan out!
As a small, but rapidly expanding firm, you’ll need to enjoy working in small teams with a wide range of skills and experience and be excited about the opportunity to help build the company over the coming years, with the potential to grow into a senior leadership role.
You’ll have excellent communication and organisational skills and won’t be afraid to say when you do not understand something and need help – we work closely as a team and are keen to help each other learn.
Finally, you will also need to be fluent in English and hold a valid UK work visa.

Requirements:
We’ve talked through our technology stack and working environments above, but as long as you’re someone who loves to code and learn with proven experience then we’d love to hear from you!
Our only hard requirement is for you to hold a valid UK work visa.

Nice to have:
Experience working in a test-driven environment
Experience developing fault-tolerant real-time services
Experience with modern DevOps technologies (CICD, Terraform, Ansible etc.)
Experience with stream processing frameworks (Spark etc.)
Rail domain experience
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field
Experience working with an Agile development methodology

Why you’ll love working at JNCTION
JNCTION will give you an amazing opportunity to develop your skills and expand within the team. We’d love to see the individual in this role develop into a Technical Lead or similar over the coming years as we grow.
The salary for the role varies depending on experience, however the expected salary range is between £40,000 to £55,000 per annum.
You’ll work closely with our experienced Head of Software who will provide career guidance and technical mentorship to you as part of the role.
You’ll also have the opportunity and be encouraged to apply for share options and will automatically qualify for JNCTION’s bonus scheme.
Finally, you’ll also get to enjoy our regular team social events and will get to help shape the team’s reward schemes for the future.

Company Benefits
Annual bonus scheme
Share options available
Fast-paced promotion cycle
Cycle-to-work scheme

CV and application letter/email

Technical task
Interview with Head of Development

Company Description

About M3 Inc:
M3 is the global leader in digital solutions in healthcare. We work with a range of sectors including healthcare, life sciences, pharmaceuticals, biotechnology and charities; services provided to these sectors include market research, medical education programs, promotional programs, clinical development, job recruitment and clinic appointment services. M3 has grown by more than 20% year-on-year for the past 15 years, achieving over 1 billion dollars in revenue annually.
Founded in 2000, with start-up investment capital from Sony, M3’s mission is to make use of the internet to increase, as much as possible, the number of people who can live longer and healthier lives, and to reduce, as much as possible, the amount of unnecessary medical costs. Key achievements of M3 Inc. include:
Named in Fortune’s 2020 ‘Future 50’ list, ahead of Facebook and Amazon
Ranked in Forbes’ 2020 Global 2000 list of the world’s largest public companies
M3 is the only company incorporated after the year 2000 to be included in the Nikkei 225 Index
Listed in Forbes’ ‘Asia’s 200 Best Over a Billion’ in 2019
In 2020 M3 founded the ‘M3: Stop COVID-19 Fund’ and pledged one billion yen to support COVID-19 related initiatives
M3’s legacy lies in the power of trusted physician platforms. Around the world, M3 organizations leverage these highly engaged digital communities to deliver medical education, job placement, and market research, to improve global patient outcomes.

Data Scientist - Ecommerce | Hatfield | Hybrid (2 days office)

About us:
Data Science is responsible for designing cutting-edge machine learning and optimisation techniques to convert data into important business insights and solutions. We focus on machine learning and optimisation problems across Ocado’s ecommerce - from recommending products to customers, to search optimisation and intelligent substitutions. Our data is stored in GoogleBigQuery, we work primarily in Python for machine learning and use frameworks such as Apache Beam and TensorFlow. We are looking for someone with experience in developing and optimising data science products as we seek to improve the personalisation capabilities and their performance for our OSP platform.

About the role:
As a Data Scientist you will work closely with the team lead, management, other data scientists and software engineering teams to identify, scope, plan and manage projects, and effectively communicate complex technical issues and findings to a range of technical and non-technical internal audiences. You will work on projects in all the areas touched by data science, dealing with complex problems and having a real impact on the operational performance of the company.
